Hi! Would like to ask experienced car owners here. I’m buying my first car. I’m in a dilemma.1. Toyota Vios 1.5A E  45k mileage2. Toyota Corolla Altis 1.6A  110k mileageConsidering all else the same. Eg. Price  years of COE left  depreciation. Both are manufactured in 2010.Which would you choose (1 or 2) and why?Many thanks! 😀

I would go with the vios because of the lower mileage but before making a decision I would put them through a PPI and make sure there's no hidden wear and tear or issues to be fixed and the mileage isn't tampered with
Appreciate your response Arnav!May I know what’s a PPI?Looking forward to more opinions as well.
Basically it’s like a medical check up
Would AA be the best place to go?
We can’t give you an exact shop
Thanks for sharing your thoughts.Looking forward to hearing more opinions on the 2 choices
Hahaha I’m just sharing deals that I found for all drivers out here
Maybe the 45 k mileage is fake
Nope  AA doesn't do thorough inspections
Would an inspection be able to pick up on whether the mileage number is fake?
Vicom and sta are good base inspections
In case you want an in depth inspection go to a workshop that deals with a lot of Toyotas and Hondas
I see. Do you happen to have a workshop recommendation?
Honda specialist should be able to give Toyotas a go
There’s alot actually and depending on your budget
Here's some suggested by sgcm team
If the dealer is not very keen on the inspection  walk away from the deal
Or they only wanna go to their preferred workshop
Usually those dealers aren't the best to deal with if there are any issues with the car after purchase as well
If they say only vicom or sta  that's still ok
Just that these two centers probably can't check for Odo tampering
